page.title: 10Education 2
page.content: The private schools also cater for 7 to 11 year olds and have boarding facilities which serve a national and international clientele. At the age of 14, for the first time, a pupil can choose 8 or 9 subjects which she or he wishes to study. These lead to GCE and CSE Exams. The resources available at these schools are greater because of the subject specialisation necessary. From 16 years onwards Education is no longer compulsory and is even more subject based with a choice of 3 or 4 GCE 'A' levels to be taken over 2 years, or further 'O'levels in 1 year. Although the town has no University, Technical College or Polytechnic,there are some Adult Education facilities at the Daniel Road centre, and the local Libraries run an adult literacy scheme called Read and Write.
